title.narrative: Support to Mali Side Event at CoP 21 Paris
Support to Mali Side Event at CoP 21 Paris

description.narrative:
The Embassy of Sweden in its capacity of lead donor (Coordinator) in Environment and Climate Change has received a request from the Ministry of Environment, Sanitation and Sustainable development for a joint support with other donors to the Side Event referred above.
In the framework of Paris’s declaration on Aid effectiveness operationalized through the Joint Assistance Strategy and the National Aid effectiveness plan, the donor community has organized itself in coordination, dialogue and working groups in Mali. Since January 2011, Sweden assumes the role of lead donor (Coordinator) in environment and climate change until the end of 2015.
Sweden’s leadership of the donor coordination group on environment and climate change has been judged very successful. This group conducted dialogue, representing the donor community, with the Malian government, which has contributed to the improved mainstreaming of environment and climate change issues into the Poverty Reduction Strategy Document for Mali 2012-2017. It has further facilitated the development of a national climate change policy and strategy. The arguments above are experiences which support that objectives will be met.
The United Nations Climate Change Conference of Parties, CoP21 will be held in Paris, France from 30 November to 11 December 2015. The overarching goal of the Convention is to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to limit the global temperature increase to 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels. During previous climate negotiations, industrialized countries agreed to outline their respective commitments of green gas emissions known as Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDCs) . These countries intended to take the INDCs within a global agreement by March 2015 while the less advanced countries were to make available their INDCs by October 2015. By September 28, 2015, Mali has made available its INDC at the UNFCCC’s Web site.
In early 2012, the Government of Mali with support of the donor community including Sweden initiated a process of creating a climate fund as a vehicle to fund the implementation of Mali’s Strategy for Green Economy and Climate Resilience. The financial resources of the Mali Climate Fund are intended to come from the government budget, environmental taxes to be created, bilateral and multilateral donors, civil society and the private sector. Sweden and Norway have contributed to the Fund set-up and operationalization. Concerning the Mali Climate Fund, the stakeholders and beneficiaries consider it to be relevant according to their needs. Weaknesses which relate to the late functionality of the Technical Secretariat of the Fund and the delay in developing the governing and monitoring documents have been addressed from April to October 2015 and are being solved.
Mali plans to take advantage from the CoP 21 in order to promote its climate fund in a Side Event. The current project aims at supporting the Mali’s side Event in Paris during the CoP 21 in order to promote the Mali Climate Fund. The specific objectives of the event are to: • Share the Mali Climate Fund experience in an international forum; • Promote and increase the funds mobilization and management mechanisms; • Take advantage from other international experiences; • Explore new funding opportunities.
